intro: Thompsonella nellydiegoae, commonly known as Nelly Diego's Thompsonella, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring or early summer, producing vibrant purple or pink flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
